title: Enacts the automated sales suppression act
summary: Enacts the automated sales suppression act to study and report on the use of automated sales suppression devices that falsify the electronic records of point-of-sale systems for the purpose of tax evasion.
fulltext:
S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2611

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 26, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sen. KRUEGER -- read twice and ordered printed, and when
         printed to be committed to the Committee on Finance

       AN ACT to amend the executive law, in relation to enacting the automated
         sales suppression act

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Short  title. This act shall be known and may be cited as
    2  the "automated sales suppression act".
    3    S 2. The executive law is amended by adding a  new  section  170-c  to
    4  read as follows:
    5    S 170-C. AUTOMATED SALES SUPPRESSION STUDY AND REPORT. 1. DEFINITIONS.
    6  (A)  "AUTOMATED SALES SUPPRESSION DEVICE" OR "ZAPPER" SHALL MEAN A SOFT-
    7  WARE PROGRAM,  CARRIED  ON  A  MEMORY  STICK,  REMOVABLE  COMPACT  DISC,
    8  ACCESSED  THROUGH  AN INTERNET LINK OR ACCESSED THROUGH ANY OTHER MEANS,
    9  THAT FALSIFIES THE ELECTRONIC RECORDS OF POINT-OF-SALE SYSTEMS  FOR  THE
   10  PURPOSE OF TAX EVASION.
   11    (B)  "DEPARTMENT"  SHALL  MEAN  THE  STATE  DEPARTMENT OF TAXATION AND
   12  FINANCE.
   13    (C) "ELECTRONIC CASH REGISTER" SHALL MEAN A DEVICE THAT KEEPS A REGIS-
   14  TER OR SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS THROUGH THE MEANS OF AN ELECTRONIC DEVICE OR
   15  COMPUTER SYSTEM DESIGNED TO RECORD TRANSACTION DATA FOR THE  PURPOSE  OF
   16  COMPUTING,  COMPILING  OR  PROCESSING  RETAIL  SALES TRANSACTION DATA IN
   17  WHATEVER MANNER.
   18    (D) "PHANTOM-WARE" SHALL MEAN A HIDDEN, PRE-INSTALLED OR INSTALLED  AT
   19  A  LATER  TIME PROGRAMMING OPTION EMBEDDED IN THE OPERATING SYSTEM OF AN
   20  ELECTRONIC CASH REGISTER OR HARDWIRED INTO THE ELECTRONIC CASH  REGISTER
   21  THAT  CAN  BE  USED  TO CREATE A VIRTUAL SECOND TILL OR MAY ELIMINATE OR
   22  MANIPULATE RECORDS THAT MAY OR MAY NOT BE PRESERVED IN  DIGITAL  FORMATS
   23  TO REPRESENT THE TRUE OR MANIPULATED RECORD OF TRANSACTIONS IN THE ELEC-
   24  TRONIC CASH REGISTER.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD07846-01-1

       S. 2611                             2

    1    (E)  "SUPPORTING  DOCUMENTS" SHALL MEAN ANY RECEIPT, INVOICE OR REPORT
    2  THAT PROVIDES A RECORD OF TRANSACTION DATA OR TRANSACTION REPORTS.
    3    (F)  "TRANSACTION  DATA"  SHALL INCLUDE ITEMS PURCHASED BY A CUSTOMER,
    4  THE PRICE FOR EACH ITEM, A TAXABILITY DETERMINATION  FOR  EACH  ITEM,  A
    5  SEGREGATED TAX AMOUNT FOR EACH OF THE TAXED ITEMS, THE AMOUNT OF CASH OR
    6  CREDIT  TENDERED, THE NET AMOUNT RETURNED TO THE CUSTOMER IN CHANGE, THE
    7  DATE AND TIME OF THE PURCHASE,  THE  NAME,  ADDRESS  AND  IDENTIFICATION
    8  NUMBER  OF  THE  VENDOR, AND THE RECEIPT OR INVOICE NUMBER OF THE TRANS-
    9  ACTION.
   10    (G) "TRANSACTION REPORTS" SHALL MEAN A  REPORT  DOCUMENTING,  BUT  NOT
   11  LIMITED  TO, THE SALES, TAXES COLLECTED, MEDIA TOTALS AND DISCOUNT VOIDS
   12  AT AN ELECTRONIC CASH REGISTER THAT IS PRINTED ON CASH REGISTER TAPE  AT
   13  THE  END  OF  A DAY OR SHIFT, OR A REPORT DOCUMENTING EVERY ACTION AT AN
   14  ELECTRONIC CASH REGISTER THAT IS STORED ELECTRONICALLY.
   15    (H) "TECHNOLOGICAL COUNTERMEASURES" SHALL MEAN ANY ELECTRONIC  DEVICE,
   16  COMPUTER  SYSTEM  OR  SOFTWARE  PROGRAM  DESIGNED  TO ASSIST AUDITORS IN
   17  DETECTING THE PRESENCE AND/OR USE OF ZAPPERS OR  PHANTOM-WARE  IN  ELEC-
   18  TRONIC CASH REGISTERS, BY VERIFYING THE AUTHENTICITY OF TRANSACTION DATA
   19  RECORDED IN SUPPORTING DOCUMENTS AND/OR TRANSACTION REPORTS.
   20    2.  THE  DEPARTMENT  IS  HEREBY  AUTHORIZED  AND DIRECTED TO PREPARE A
   21  COMPREHENSIVE  STUDY  DOCUMENTING  THE   PREVALENCE   OF   ZAPPERS   AND
   22  PHANTOM-WARE WITHIN THE STATE'S RETAIL INDUSTRY, FOCUSING ON CASH TRANS-
   23  ACTIONS,  BUT  NOT  LIMITED  TO,  THE USE OF ZAPPERS AND PHANTOM-WARE AT
   24  RESTAURANTS, MOVIE  THEATERS,  HAIRDRESSERS,  AMUSEMENT  PARKS,  GROCERY
   25  STORES, CONVENIENCE STORES OR ANY OTHER RETAIL ESTABLISHMENT WHERE THERE
   26  IS A HIGH VOLUME OF CASH TRANSACTIONS.
   27    (A)  SUCH  STUDY  SHALL  ALSO  PROVIDE AN ESTIMATE ON THE TOTAL FISCAL
   28  IMPACT THAT ZAPPERS AND PHANTOM-WARE HAVE ON THE STATE, FOCUSING ON, BUT
   29  NOT LIMITED TO, THE ESTIMATED TOTAL REDUCTION IN GROSS RETAIL SALES,  AS
   30  WELL  AS  THE  ESTIMATED TOTAL AMOUNT OF TAX REVENUES THE STATE DOES NOT
   31  COLLECT BECAUSE OF THE FALSIFIED TRANSACTION DATA  PRODUCED  BY  ZAPPERS
   32  AND PHANTOM-WARE.
   33    (B)  SUCH STUDY SHALL CONSIDER TECHNOLOGICAL COUNTERMEASURES THE STATE
   34  COULD EMPLOY OR REQUIRE BUSINESSES TO USE TO ENHANCE  THE  DETECTION  OF
   35  ZAPPERS  OR  PHANTOM-WARE USED IN OR INSTALLED IN ELECTRONIC CASH REGIS-
   36  TERS. THE DEPARTMENT IS AUTHORIZED AND DIRECTED TO INCLUDE IN THIS STUDY
   37  ITS RECOMMENDATION OF WHICH TECHNOLOGICAL COUNTERMEASURE  WOULD  BE  THE
   38  MOST EFFECTIVE AND COST-EFFICIENT.
   39    3.  THE DEPARTMENT SHALL SUBMIT THE FINDINGS OF SUCH STUDY IN A REPORT
   40  TO THE DIRECTOR OF THE DIVISION OF THE BUDGET, THE  TEMPORARY  PRESIDENT
   41  OF  THE  SENATE, THE SENATE MINORITY LEADER, THE SPEAKER OF THE ASSEMBLY
   42  AND THE ASSEMBLY MINORITY LEADER NO MORE THAN FIVE  HUNDRED  FORTY  DAYS
   43  AFTER THE ENACTMENT OF THIS SECTION.
   44    4.  NOTHING  IN THIS SECTION SHALL PERMIT OR REQUIRE THE DEPARTMENT TO
   45  INCLUDE IN THE REPORT DESCRIBED IN SUBDIVISION TWO OF THIS  SECTION  ANY
   46  LISTING  OF  ANY INDIVIDUAL BUSINESSES' TAX LIABILITY, PROFITS, SALES OR
   47  LOSSES OR ANY INFORMATION PERTAINING TO ANY ON-GOING  ADMINISTRATIVE  OR
   48  CRIMINAL  INVESTIGATION BY THE DEPARTMENT, U.S. INTERNAL REVENUE SERVICE
   49  OR ANY LAW ENFORCEMENT ENTITY INTO THE USE, INSTALLATION, MANUFACTURING,
   50  OR LEASING OF ZAPPERS OR PHANTOM-WARE.
   51    S 2. This act shall take effect on the ninetieth day  after  it  shall
   52  have become a law.
